title: Early voting in Boston starts this weekend. Here’s where you can cast your ballot.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Politics The early voting period for Boston’s general election will begin Oct.
25 and take place through Oct.
31 at select polling locations.

title: Former White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre declares herself ‘Independent’
author: Blake Maddux
bullets: Books The former White House Press Secretary discusses her frustration with the current state of both her former political home and the two-party system itself in her new book.
File - Karine Jean-Pierre during a press briefing in the White House in 2022.
Saul Loeb/AFP By Blake Maddux October 23, 2025 | 7:34 PM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Former MLB GM believes Red Sox will likely trade Jarren Duran this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "Teams such as the Phillies, Dodgers, Tigers, Guardians and Rangers would love to land him.
" Jarren Duran could be a top trade chip for the Red Sox this offseason.
Photo by Matthew J Lee/Globe Staff By Conor Ryan October 23, 2025 | 7:20 PM 2 minutes to read Something’s got to give with the Red Sox’ logjam in the outfield this offseason.

title: Report exposes culture of hazing and humiliation at Cape Cod police academy
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The East Falmouth Police Academy opened its doors in January.
By March, academy leadership had been suspended and all staff instructors temporarily removed.
The Municipal Police Training Committee hosted an unrelated training session in Andover in 2023.

title: Chunk of MBTA’s downtown concourse ceiling falls due to water damage
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “We thank the public for notifying the T about the station issue at Park Street earlier this week," the MBTA said.
A hole in the ceiling of the MBTA's Winter Street Concourse.
Molly Farrar/Boston.

title: SNL’s Rachel Dratch shares sunrise performance by Yo-Yo Ma in Hanover, N.H.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Celebs “Sharing this moment of peace and beauty on the Connecticut River at sunrise,” Dratch wrote on Instagram.
An animated Ma laughs and jokes at the Community Music Center of Boston on June 16, 2022.

(Lane Turner/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas October 23, 2025 | 4:51 PM 1 minute to read SNL’s Rachel Dratch took to social media on Wednesday to share a stunning sunrise performance by acclaimed cellist Yo-Yo Ma in Hanover, New Hampshire.
